review: Awesome food!!!!!  Have the prime rib dip with sweet potato fries.  Heaven call is there "go to" restaurant  .
If you like strawberries & lemonade, their strawberry lemonade is tops! Having the yummy chicken caesar salad. Waitress (Emily) is super nice!

Sadly, I no longer live in this part of town, but every time we end up heading to the Tucson Mall, Husband and I stop at Red Robin. As far as we know, it's the only place  in town where you can get a "Royal Burger," which is topped with bacon and a fried egg. Sounds weird, tastes YUMMY! (Make sure to ask for the egg to be a bit runny, otherwise it will be fried hard and lack the awesome ooziness that makes the burger so great.) The fry seasoning is also to die for on the regular fries, and the sweet potato fries with sea salt are unique and delicious. Burgers are huge, I can usually eat only half, so skip the appetizer! The service has always been just fine, even when things are a bit busy. Frequent enough to refill your lemonade when it's empty, but not enough to get annoying. Advice: rather than coming in directly through the entrance in the middle of the mall, head towards the exterior doors and come in the "back." That section is WAY quieter and you'll actually be able to hear your conversation! Overall, well worth the 30 minute drive from the SE side of town. Maybe we'll get lucky and they'll build one near Park Place!

Red Robin! Why do you do me like this! I saw their pic for the new bacon melt burger and it looked heavenly....then when it came it looked not so heavenly:( Only if they can make a burger like how the picture it looks.  Our server had an off day so I'm not going to bash the restaurant for the service. We have been there off and on for a quick bite during football season to see a little football and had great service. Seems like you always have to be at the bar to get the service you need. My wifes salad was the worst she has ever had. The lettuce was sad and the dressing was garbage.  Come on Red Robin...get your act together! The competition surrounding is going to eat you up if you're not careful.

We went for the late night meal as well as for my birthday coupon emailed to me. (I subscribe). I had only been to this Red Robin once before, but so far I'm still satisfied. I had a guacamole bacon burger and my boyfriend had the burning love burger. Both were delicious and came with those unlimited steak fries...yum! I also got a bottomless rootbeer float, which was exactly what they said it was and more....it was so delicious I got a second one. And it was late and there were turning off the machines and our server gave us a third one (which he let me take home)! He also gave us two orders more of the bottomless steak fries, which we also had to take home because who can eat that much incredible food!! All and all it was a great meal and we certainly got our monies worth. Definitely going to come back again a little sooner than the last time :) also great decor!

It was alright, they weren't busy at all and they still stuck us in a corner and pretty much hidden away from anyone or anything, weird. The waitress was eh ok, she pretty much rushed/ignored my kids when their were trying to give her their orders or trying to make small talk since no one was there and they wanted to just say hi, since we are new to the area they like to talk to people and get to know them. the food was good, i have been to better RR's though. We didn't get waited on but once the whole time we were there so that was a major downer because you know people do drink their drinks and more then likely want a refill and not just chew on the ice since they didn't come refill our drinks till we were almost ready to leave.

Did someone say hamburger? Wow, this was a burger and a half! Maybe a little bigger portion than anyone should ever eat, so recommend splitting, even though you won't want to. I ordered the spicy spicy burning love burger and loved every minute of it. If you like spicy you should try it.

I heart Red Robin. Yeah, it's industrial, but dang; they do a good burger.  We were introduced to Red Robin's by the original Anchorage location in the Northway Mall. The kids would eat there, and you could get a decent meal with booze. What's not to like? I heard that the Tucson Mall Red Robin doesn't have a full menu. But they do OK by me.

Ok, so you're thinkin' 'why on Earth is this girl eating at Red Robin in Tucson when there is a plethora of amazingly good OTHER places'.  I know, I know.  It was a bad decision but ya know...the kids,,,yeah the kids.  It's their fault.  So whatever we went there. Kids had a burger or whatever and it was fine.  I had the caesar salad with grilled salmon on top.  I know!  "What was she thinking ordering salmon in the desert??'.  Alright already!  It was so freakin' bad, that I sent it back.  The salmon was hard as a shingle and the whole thing looked like a big mess.  And since all the other crap on their menu looked just as distasteful I did not eat lunch there.  I know, I know.
Burgers are fun, creative and gotta love the never ending fries as if the huge burgers weren't enough :)  I prefer going to local burger joints, but you can't go wrong with Red Robin.

As a general rule, I like Red Robin.  My first time here will be my last.   The service was terribly slow.  Over 50 minutes for two standard menu burgers (no special requests) and they still got the order wrong.  The server was terribly rude.  The cook was joking around with the waitstaff instead of cooking the orders (and messing them up - since our order was wrong.)  My friend walked out.  The server expected me to pay for his food - even though he already complained and said he was leaving.  The manager never came out and apologized.  Mind you, the restaurant was not busy (only 2 tables had customers in the whole upper area). I will never return here and advise everyone else, this location is terrible.  Save yourself the aggravation and go to a fast food joint.

I received a reward card for my birthday. off I went to the only red robin in Tucson. I took a friend along who's a classically trained executive chef . I've gotten birthday coupons from assorted places but it's a bit of a cr@p shoot as to how the server treats the coupon holder. I additionally have celiac so it can be tricky. Chef (whose name I will withhold)asked our server all the pertinent gluten questions, and what we heard was a fully educated staff. BRENT SMITH was friendly, informative and  made no gluten mistakes at all. My meal was great, Chef's full gluten meal was also excellent. We later discussed each step of the meal and between us, we could find NOTHING even slightly questionable. Chef and I both agreed it was one of the best meals ever. The burgers were drip to your elbows juicy; the service was superior; and they DEFINITLY got the gluten right. The coupon was no issue whatsoever. Thank you Brent!!!
Always yummy burgers and the MOST delicious bottomless fries.  Can't beat the prices or the happy hour.

Beer - Dos Equis Amber - blah blah blah - wish they would bring in a better beer on tap Food - Sorry to say (because they're a chain) I LOVE their bacon cheeseburger.  Literally been my favorite burger in Tucson for a very long time.  And they still do it right and they still do it the same way.  I would downgrade most places for their mediocre beer selection but I love their burger that much. Service - depends on the day - all about the burger

Very friendly and helpful staff, on a Saturday night we got seated fairly fast to a nice 2 person booth.  Our waiter was young, down to earth and very helpful, which is rare to find in the restaurant business.  The food arrived very quickly and the young waiter checked back several times even on a busy night. I was very pleased with the service, however the food was so so. Again it is a chain restaurant, I would defiantly return for the A+ service.

these place has been around for a long time since i was a kid. I been here before the burgers are not bad the price is high for a burger. i stop by to drink a beer to help me deal with  some shopping i had to do  in the mall. happy hour was slow  at the bar  no very happy hour but the staff was up beat the hang out by the bar when there clocking  out. the service was fine  i just had a beer  but the  place is small with all kinds of stuff on the wall

Terrible customer service. I ordered a salad and asked for extra dressing--they gave me two containers that were half full, no bread, and a roll of the eyes when I inquired about these.  If you are willing to put up with attitude, then I suppose you'll be able to tolerate...

If you want a decent burger,  this is the place you want  to  be.   The service is typically good, although we have had some that move pretty slow.  The chili and onion rings are great!    A bit pricey but definitely worth it.  Way better that the cardboard you'll  get at In & Out. The only significant downside is parking.  The  Tucson Mall can get pretty crazy.
When cooked correctly, the Bleu Ribbon burger is one of my all-time favorites. But, this place is hit and miss.
Lousy burger, poorly prepared! A McDonalds quarter pounder has more flavor.

This place is always great! Sometimes the service leaves something to be desired from time to time, but more often than not it is fantastic!! I really love the food here. One of my favorite items is the Banzai Burger. Grilled pineapple is such an awesome thing to have on a burger. Plus the addition of teriyaki sauce gives it another unique twist.  Three words make it better: Bottomless Steak Fries. Literally as much as your happy food craving heart can desire. Top em with some of the special seasoning to add extra flavor!! My inner food loving kid is always satisfied when I come here!!

This was a 3rd visit.  The 1st - good food/good service.   The 2nd - good food/lousy service/poor janitorial upkeep in men's restroom.  The 3rd visit - good food/good service.  The server memorized order and exactly what we ordered arrived promptly.  Staff attention to keeping the men's bathroom tidy was evident.   Original server and his replacement both checked back with us.   The lettuce wrap burger was very good.  Of course, being a CA chain, they are probably ahead of the curve on this particular dining preference!

Overall liked the service, food, and menu selection, very generous waitress offered us appetizers for free. Great burger selection, and all organic meat products!  Where can u get that in a chain restaurant? Great big mud pie awesome! We'll be back. thank you!!

Not good, not bad, kinda stuck in between. Again this is a location specific review as I like RR as a chain, but I am not crazy on this location.  Small dining location, nothing bothersome, though I have been in bigger ones at malls across the nation. The waitress we had this afternoon was not very good or was having a bad day (I am hoping the latter). Things were forgotten, orders wrong and often had to flag her down. Just not something I like to do. The husband ordered a burger and wanted no pink, the burger came out pretty pink and cold. My sandwich (BLTA) was good. They didn't serve very many fries with the food which is understandable because you can always get more ... -if- you can get the attention of your server. We could not, so we paid the bill and left. We just kinda felt forgotten and left with me being satisfied and him disappointed.  We will not be going back. With so many other options in the mall, it will be easy to pass up.

This place is not worth the money that they charge.  I had a simple bacon cheeseburger with grilled onions. The very first bite I took it tasted burnt, waitress asked if there was a problem I told her and she didn't try to fix it.  I figured by the way it tasted that they didn't scrub the grill every so often and whatever gets burned on the grill may come off on your burger. The waitress we had was nice , but she acted so nervous with everything she did.
The prices were comparable to similar restaurants and the service was average. Nothing super special.
Friendly staff very attentive to food allergies food was great came out in a very timely manner very happy with the service
Service was slow. Food was not cooked all the way. Fries were old. Will never go back.

I've eaten here a lot but only a couple times in last couple months. I like it more than the other places around the mall, the food is always good and the atmosphere is busy and lively during lunch. You know that it won't be the finest burger you've ever tasted, but some of the more unique ones are pretty yummy, such as the Banzai burger or the Bruschetta Chicken Burger. Prices are comparable to what you'd expect at a place like this. The option of bottom fries is great, especially for hungry teens or college students  just wanting to hang out. Service has always been fine as well, generally very friendly.

We had to seat ourselves because nobody was there hosting. Then it took them a good 10 minutes to finally acknowledge us and give us forks and another 5 to ask what drinks we were having. The burger was fine, just the customer service was terrible. It was my birthday too and the waitress did not wish me happy birthday. Go for the burger, not the service.

Stopped in for a Saturday lunch. We got the Pretzel Bite appetizers. They came out within 8 minutes. They were hot and fresh. Very good.  We ordered their Tavern Double burgers, which come with endless fries. They came out about 15 minutes after the appetizer. Perfect timing. The burgers were well cooked along with the fries. Server also brought ranch for the fries. The server was attentive and courteous. When we were ready to leave she filled two cups with iced tea. Put lids on them for us to take along. Nobody has ever done this for us at this restaurant. Food was good. We will try this place again.

Great Burgers n bottomless fries.  This is a family restaurant in the Tucson Mall and a chain hamburger restaurant.  I enjoy the flavored raspberry tea and the family sportsbar atmosphere.  I don't do the alcohol drinks, which I was not impressed with the selection, but you come here for the burgers.   The service today was mixed.  We had several check ins as we talked but had not decided, but then the waiter disappeared for about 10 minutes and provided minimal service for the rest of the meal.  This was unusual from my past experiences.  I also joined the club to get offers and my birthday burger.

How can you go wrong with in this fries and a refillable root beer float, now that's what I'm talking about I have the chicken burger and it was one of the best you can't go wrong with the place that has delicious burgers what's not only beef options the chicken options also, I was really surprised that I was able to get a refill on my root beer float you don't find that many places;  and trust when I say it was delicious extremely delicious!! Can't wait to go back

I love coming here. I love the food, I love the endless fries, I love the endless freckled lemonade. I do not enjoy the service as much. The servers are always kind of weird and not necessarily great. So it's the food that keeps me coming back, definitely not the service.

Ate with family, located at Tucson Mall. Delicious burgers. Liked the strawberry lemonade - unlimited refills. The appetizer wedge salad is large for the $3 charge and was good. Service was good for the most part.

Went here last night for a date, and it was amazing. I don't know about any of the other negative reviews, maybe they weren't at the same location as me, but I had a great time.  I had the "Red Tavern Double" and it tasted really good. My boyfriend had the Whisky BBQ Burger and he loved it. I loved the fries, and their spice seasoning. Our server was also amazing, I think his name was David or Daniel, but he knew how to treat customers. We left him a $10 tip, he totally deserved it. I didn't have a single problem there, and I'll definitely be back again.

Unfortunately this particular location does not stack up to the other locations I've been to. We showed up on a Thursday night at 5:30 and totally expected to wait but we were told the wait would be 10 minutes. 30 minutes later we got seated and we waited another 10 minutes for someone to come to our table. We were then informed when the waiter brought our drinks that they were out of ice so we were stuck with luke warm tap water. He seemed unapologetic. I ordered chili and my husband ordered a burger, we waited about another 30 minutes for our food. When the food arrived, they forgot his side of bbq sauce he requested and since our waiter disappeared, we had to ask another server for the bbq sauce. Nobody returned to our table and we had to waive down our waiter for the check. It was not until that moment that he offered to refill our empty water glasses. We saw that he was serving 4 other (small party) tables but then would disappear into the back. Normally I'd chalk it up to a bad waiter but the entire staff appeared to be unorganized and uninterested in being there. The management at this restaurant needs to step it up because I've been to other locations in the Midwest with consistently excellent service.

Pretty impressive first time I've ordered a Burger midium rare a nd actually got it that way. Also very well presented and was tasty . All so if your hungry fries are bottomless. Friendly fast service .

I'm not a big fan of "chain restaurants ". But after a long day of Christmas shopping at Tucson Mall, we decided to eat at Red Robins rather than the food court. And boy am I glad we did. The service was fast and attentive.  My Ensenada Chicken Platter was delicious. It was hot, fresh and flavorful.  My boyfriend said his Lone Star Burger was great. Overall, a good experience and we will be back!

This place is good.  Good food, good service, good drinks.   Having eaten at several Red Robins in different cities and states this one is the best so far. The service is fast and friendly and the food tastes good.   This place is located at the mall and is on the lower level next to Sears and See's Candies.

Excellent service. Was seated right away. Waiter, Gabe, was very helpful. Suggested that I go with the bottomless fries option, rather than ordering fries on their own. Checked a few other times during the meal. Very impressed with his service.  Noticed that he made conversation with other customers; most waiters don't do that.  He actually made suggestions to his guests and helped them decide what to order.  The only complaint I have is that my sweet potato fries were not very warm. Almost room temp.  Other than that, food was good, service was excellent. Not to mention that Gabe was very easy on the eyes :) Defiantly going there again.
6pm on a Friday. Not crazy but steady. Took 15 minutes to seat us...15 minutes of waiting for a server to even greet us...never came. Not impressed.

A great place to stop while shopping. Affordable food for everyone in the family. They have recently started offering smaller sizes of their appetizers which is perfect for lunch. You can get in and back out to shopping. Ask for a to-go cup and take your drink with you. Make sure you sign up for their rewards program. Free burger on your birthday!!!
My roommates always come here for a roommates night out! The wait staff is always super nice, and the food is great!

I hadn't eaten here in years, mostly because it is not in our neighborhood but also because there are so many better local restaurants nearby.  But we were on this side of town and opted to get some takeout from here.  We were looking forward to our burgers that looked so good and BIG.  But our excitement quickly subsided once we started eating.  Everything was there except the flavor.  For whatever reason our burgers tasted completely bland, we couldn't even figure out how it could be possible to look so good and taste so blah.  We both ate about half our burgers and even less of our fries and sadly tossed the rest.  Oh well.
Love coming here. Always delicious and service is usually fair; they do become very busy at times and is what contributes to a "fair" service rating. I will continue to find a Red Robin wherever I go

Good food, but poor service. Long wait time for a seat eventually sat at the bar. Tried to order a beer and the bartender ignored me. When i finally got the beer she had forgotten to add it to my bill, so naturally i asked for a receipt to make sure everything was kosher. Bartender proceeded to get snipity and make rude comments when asked for the receipt, i was not accusing her just wanted to make sure the bill was correct. I've never been treated so poorly, there are plenty of other restaurants in the area that deserve your money.
Good food.  Service is always slow though. Love the endless ties and bbq wrap. If only my kids would get their own so I don't have to share.

Our first time at this place. Service no that good. Our server was defenetly not a spokesman. We had to keep asking questions about the menu. We went with their normal cheese burger and it was an okay burger. I can now say been there done that. Maybe if the waiter kept up with our drinks and made the experience better  I would give it a better rating.

awesome place to eat, very friendly staff, clean restaurant,  and very accommodating to my dietary needs! We always love coming here for lunch when we're out and about. service time is pretty good and food is always great! Even when things have gotten messed up, they are very quick to apologize and get it remade.
Great burgers, good fries, great price. I have never been disappointed by a burger here so we will keep coming back.

Went in to give the restaurant a second chance after having a terrible experience before and it was great. Our server Reggie was very attentive and had a happy positive attitude. He was always smiling. The Burgers and fries were delicious! Great customer service and food! We will definitely be coming back and hope that we have the same server too! He was awesome.

I have liked Red Robin for at least 20 years and they consistently serve good food. Especially the steak fries, mad props to Red Robin for not cheaping out over time. I don't hate on a restaurant just because it's a chain, as long as it has good food and fair prices. I look forward to coming back to Red Robin again!

We have been eating at Red Robin restaurants for years and in many different locations. This location in Tucson AZ has the worst service I have ever experienced. This was our third time trying this location and the service was horrible each time. Food is great, but will not be returning to this location again.
Please don't be fooled by the name "Burgers", they have SO much more!  Hot dinners, salads, you name it.  And it's all delicious and service is excellent.

Back when Tucson Mall was the only real mall in town, my husband and I shopped there for gifts for each other. We would meet up at Red Robin and have a couple of drinks after. Sadly, we never ate there! Park Place renovated and that became our go to mall. My husband needed a new suit and the Tucson Mall store had his size. We decided to go there instead of waiting for it to be sent to Park Place. I took my girls to Old Navy and spent way too much money while my husband bought his suit. After, we were all tired and hungry. Red Robin was at the right place at the right time! The burgers are phenomenal. I have never seen my youngest devour a burger that fast! They were all cooked to perfection, mine well done, the others with pink! Our server, Reggie, was the star of the meal. He knew the menu so well, answered all of our questions, and brought a fresh drink for my daughter without being asked. My daughters both told him how awesome he was! I must say, we will do more shopping at Tucson Mall in the future!

So first I would like to say how thankful I am that red robin participants giving out free meals to veterans.  We went and had the worst service. Our waitress "Nani" was terrible. She gave one of my friends an attitude as soon as we sat down. She would ignore me and my friend because I sat next to her. After a lot of attitude and smirks and smart remarks we wanted to talk to the manager and when the manager came by and she gave us more attitude then Nani. We didn't catch the managers name but she had short red bob. She started to talk about my friend to the waitress Nani. Also I had a group of friends that went to red robin and said the same thing regarding the manager.  The food was amazing but it was terrible.

Decided to give Red Robin another try after a couple years. Disappointed nothing special here burger was alllright. Burger patty didn't taste so good fries are descent. But I wouldn't recommend this place only thing good about this experience was the hostess were cute had a little eye candy to look at!

We were out shopping and decided to get a bite to eat. Our burgers were really good and the kids meals were great too. They brought out 2 more baskets of fries which made my kids extremely happy. Overall good experience will be back.

Yummy GF Burgers and Fries. Their website is super easy to use to customize order, know what allergens are in foods, what to avoid, and how to calculate health of meal you are eating. Their restaurants are clean, upbeat, and in good locations. They are not usually in small towns though so it is a treat when traveling. The website list where they buy their foods, what is in them,  and environmental concerns to consider. That seems to shows their integrity to consumers in foods they are providing them, and the ways they give back to the community they serve.

Awesome burgers, haven't had a bad one yet, and a free one in your birthday month if you sign up for their rewards program. Bottomless steak fries are a plus; get the camp fire sauce with them, it's smoky and tangy! Order the bottomless root beer float, you won't regret it.

I'm a fan of Red Robin in general, it would take a lot for me to have a bad experience.  Our food came out hot and in a reasonable amount of time.  The service was friendly and was receptive to our needs without even having to ask-refilling drinks without us asking.  I recommend the veggie patties, or a grilled cheese as an appetizer! I do enjoy their burgers here as well, I think they are cooked well and have creative toppings. My favorite burger is the DGB (Damn Good Burger).

Went to RR last Saturday for lunch.  I ordered the chili-cheese fries.  The fries were so soggy, they were like mush.  But what was bizarre was the chili.  The meat was chunks of hamburger, like in the patty they put on the burgers.  My first thought was that they meat was left over from hamburgers that weren't eaten.  It just grossed me out.  Jeez, if you're going to use ground burger in your chili, at least grind it!   My son ordered chicken strips and fries.  The fries were very under cooked and he had to order more. Blah food, high prices and slow service.

I believe this is the only Red Robin (yuuuum!) in Tucson but that's okay cause it's great.  We've been there numerous times and the outcome is always terrific, except when our belly is to full of Root Beer floats ;) The last time we went, we had THE BEST SERVICE ever there.  Our server was fantastic and gave us the perfect amount of attention.  Food was delicious and dessert was better!!   Thank you Kaitlin & Red Robin! (04/13/16 -6:15PM -table 512)
Always great! Order your burger just the way you like it! Bottomless fries are key! Great service!

The past couple of times I have come I have received way better service.  As I stated in my first review, the service not the food was the problem, so I'm glad I can come here when I am the Tucson Mall as there aren't that many places to get a gourmet burger around the Tucson Mall.

I don't know what was going on but all restrooms were out of service but no sign was put up. Once I walked in water was all over the place and slipped and fell. I spoke to a manager but nothing was done. All he said was I try to put up a sign. Couldn't even eat because I was wet. This place sucked never again for me

I have been to this Red Robin several times.  I work close by & it is convenient to go to for lunch.  Last time I was there the service was horrible,  but I thought they may have been having a bad day, so I did not rate it. This time, it was just as bad.  It took more than 25 minutes to get our food. The person who brought it out offered no explanation,  but did apologize for it taking so long. Maybe there was something happening in the kitchen,  so I didn't hold that against our server - however, even though he passed us twice & noticed we needed our drinks refilled - it took him a third time past to remember our drinks. He noted that we only had one silverware bundle, said he would get another....that didn't happen. I ordered honey mustard dressing & got ranch. Endless fries? Not so....we were never offered. I really hope they get it together,  but I think it will he awhile before I try again!

Went on my lunch hour. Everyone around me was being served. Server took my order faster forgot my dream about 25 minutes later I still didn't get any food. All I wanted was a hamburger and french fries. Would never come back here. She actually had the nerve to ask me if I wanted my food to go. Seriously you can't get me my food in time and then you want me to take it back to work and then eat it tonight.

Arizona Burger Tour: Red Robin Judging Criteria: 1. First appearance: Well presented. Condiments were presented outside the sandwich.  2. Flavor: It was ok, if not a little plain. I took a bite without any condiments or extras and it was just ok. With the fresh sides, it definitely brightened but the patty wasn't the star.  3. Meat to bun ratio: Perfect, everything was finished at the same time. Also, each bite featured a proportional amount.  4. Included extras (veggies / condiments): lettuce, tomato, dill pickles, red onion.  5. Price: $8.99 (comes with fries).  Grade: B = Really good. The burger has good flavor but might have a flaw or two.  Follow the tour on Instagram at @Requiemofchaos

This is my first time eating here ever. Red Robin was open until 10 which is cool because I work late.  I like the idea of bottomless fries. I tried the garlic Parmesan fries. They were so good! Super garlicky and buttery and delicious! The potatoes were very good quality so I'll give them that. Get these fries they are worth the dollar! There was options for extra dipping sauces. I tried the Thai sauce......it was just sweet chili sauce and the cup was really small. Certain menu options (like their alcohol portions, I'll get to that) are misleading to the size. The sauce cup was smaller than a ketchup cup. And it was a dollar. Not worth it.  Let me be the first to congratulate you on being the first business in Tucson that legit made a mushroom Swiss burger correctly. Those mushrooms were packed on and cooked perfectly and best of all, not from a can! I can't believe how hard it has been to find a mushroom burger with real mushrooms or at least more than like 3 with some cheese. So I was excited. They have a gluten free bun option for $.49 more as well and that is always a plus for me.  I ordered the Chile Chile Cheese Fries as an appetizer and those were also cooked to perfection! They had thick slices of jalapeno peppers but they weren't too hot and it had bacon and just yum! The only reason I gave it a 4 star was the service. It was about 9 when we went in and service was slow. I'd agree with the other reviews that the bottomless fries were not offered as well which made me sad because that really seems like a selling point to me.  I also asked if they had a house margarita and they served me the most expensive one on the menu. The picture advertised a tall margarita that looked delicious and I got a tiny glass. Maybe 6 ounces after all the ice. And it tasted like the margarita that is left over after you drank the whole thing and the ice watered down the last sip. This is mainly due to who ever mixed our drinks because my fiance's mixed tea was super watered down too. It wasn't worth $8. Not even in a bar. The second round of tea was much better though.  Also the waitress was really nice but there were no suggestions made and I was kind of mad that she just ordered me the most expensive margarita they had when "house margarita" generally means cheap. I felt a bit rushed but I won't let it ruin my review. I'll give it another shot.  I was more impressed by the food than anything though I did like the decor. Pictures of famous people on the walls and interesting art.  And finally the tea! (Couldn't leave that out). Their glasses were gigantic! Free refills and ice cold. The tea did need some sweeter because it wasnt super fresh but it was nice and strong like I like it. My cup was never empty so all in all 4 stars for me. I will return.

Took my family to Red Robin for lunch, at the Tucson Mall, this past Friday (July 29, 2016). There is a mall entrance and a parking lot entrance. We entered the mall entrance as we prefer the ambiance in that dinning area. We were told there was a wait and we'd have to go to the parking lot entrance to put our name in. However, no less than 40% of the tables were unoccupied. I asked how long the wait was and the mall entrance hostess couldn't say. I was again told to ask at the rear of the restaurant. I then asked for the Manager. After waiting some time, I was informed that Brent, the Manager, was in the kitchen and said he's not coming out. We then went to the rear of the restaurant. The hostess there, Karlie, had a smart mouth. Although I saw several parties waiting for a table ahead of us. Karlie told me no one was waiting for a table. (It felt like a scene out of "The Emperor's New Clothes".). We put our name in, and were seated about five minutes thereafter. It took about 40 minutes before our food arrived. With a Manager who can't be bothered to come speak to a customer, and a Hostess who tells you the sky is colored Orange - I for one can think of many other restaurants that seem more interested in their customers.

We came here around 9:15 on Friday night. We were actually in line to be seated at Olive Garden and changed our minds last minute. I'm definitely glad that we did!  I hadn't been to Red Robin in a few years, and I've since gone vegan so I was interested to try out their veg-friendly options. My boyfriend and I both had the gardenburger with the boca patty, with sides of black beans and steak fries. We also split the Sweet Potato Fries as an appetizer. I got a freckled lemonade as well, and the total only came up to about $25 after tax which is a pretty good deal, in my opinion.  The food was phenomenal, and I would definitely say it was one of the best veggie burgers I've had in a restaurant. The servings were a little on the bigger side (even though I feel like they used to be larger back in the day) and neither of us could finish all of our food.  The place wasn't too busy because it had just finished pouring rain, and we were seated right away. It took a little bit for us to get our food, but it wasn't an issue for us. The server was very helpful and even explained all of the different vegan options we could try next time, which I appreciated.  I am sure that we'll be back in sometime in the future!

OMG!! My husband and I went to the Red Robin's at the Tucson Mall  for lunch. Will NEVER go there again. Nothing but screaming kids. While waiting to be seated, I was hit twice with a balloon that Red Robin has a "tree" for the kids to take. Obviously, parents don't know how to control their kids. At one table a kid would scream at the top of her lungs, just because. They need to have a kids section because they just lost this customer.

1) I use to be a Red Robin fan, but I went this weekend for my birthday and I was disgusted! First of all I had my baby in a stroller and when it was our time to be seated instead of the hostess taking us around to the main entrance to be seated she made me get through the stairs with my stroller to only sit us right in front of the big main opening. It was a struggle to move around peoples tables and I kept bumping into people while they where eating just to get my stroller through and she just stared at me when she could have walked us around to save the hassle!  2) The bathrooms where disgusting!! I went to change my baby and there was wet toilet paper all over the floor, trash was over flowing and the toilet seat was filthy and had a wet toilet cover cover hanging off of it.  3) Where we sat at it smelled like really old urine. We could not enjoy our dinner because it smelled so terrible near us like it was coming from the floor. 4) I asked the waitress for water and she gave me tap water and I nearly threw up once I drank it.  5) Pictures where falling from the wall!! If a picture would have fallen and hurt me or my daughter I would have sued red robin!  6) and lastly, our waitress sucked! She really seemed to not want to be there.  GET IT TOGETHER!!!!  I use to call Red Robin one of my favorite burger joints, but no way! Not anymore.  I'm very sad that I chose this place for my family to take me for dinner.

We've been here before and had pretty good service and food. Our visit there yesterday was basically average, nothing to write home about. I generally order my burger well-done, it was medium this time, not what I ordered. It took longer than usual to get our food so I didn't send my burger back to be remade. Our server wasn't the greatest, we've had much better. He wasn't rude, but we could barely hear him when he spoke to us and he came to check on us maybe twice the entire time we were there, three times if you include when he brought us our food. We will still eat here since it more than likely was a fluke this time.

It is what it is. I'm here while my car is across the street at the auto mall having some mechanical issues addressed. I don't expect high quality service by any stretch of the imagination, but sitting down at the bar I would appreciate being acknowledged sooner than 90 seconds after sitting down when there is only one other person dining at the bar. The beer is cold and the sweet tea is sweet. Its not a bad place but Red Robin isn't normally my first choice for dining.

We had a small wait to start. We ordered the S'mores sweet potato fries that were super sweet and delicious down to the last one! Then the wait for our food began. People that were sat 10 minutes after us were receiving their food prior to us. That was frustrating. We split a large bacon burger. The burger was okay. We had to ask for refills a couple of times. Not sure I'll be returning any time soon.

My sister and I went for lunch today as we wanted to have the fried zucchini sticks and we were not disappointed. The zucchini was cooked just right and the outside was lightly coated. I had the original cheeseburger while my sister had the loaded mushroom both were really good. More family members joined us and had the fried pickles ( I'm not a big fan of pickles) so I tried one and it wasn't bad. It was a good lunch with endless fries and a great  server. Now to walk the meal off...

This is a burgers, fries and desserts sit down eatery located inside the Tucson mall. We came because they have vegan food options. I love BOCA burgers and this is the only place in town that I know of where I can get one.  This is my husbands first time eating at a Red Robin and for a meat eater like him, there are many ways to smack down.  Different selections of cheese and other toppings like mushrooms and bacon.  Their Deluxe burgers include bottomless fries, curly, steak or sweet potato.  Great service!

We had a gift card so the meal was free.  We were in Tucson so we went. The fact the meal was free is the reason for the one star. The food was just so so at best. There was nothing special or great about the meal. The bun was border line stale. The burger had no flavor except for the excessive amounts of mayo that I ended up scraping off the sandwich. It was free so there's that. Oh my wife said the sweet potato fries were good.
Burger and fries were cold and over priced. Will not ever go back. This is the 2nd time and both times were less than satisfactory. Save your money and go to any other fast food burger joint.

Hostesses sucked. Didn't acknowledge customers. Food was good. Restaurant and bathrooms felt and looked dirty and greasy. Baseboards need cleaning. This was the first time I've been back in over 10 years and I probably will wait another 10 to come back again because I didn't like the atmosphere and how dirty it felt .

If I could rate Red Robin's service today it would be in NEGATIVE STARS! We've been going to Red Robin for about 16 years and have never received such terrible service as we did on this last visit! We checked with a hostess about sitting in the bar area and were told that it was open seating.  Once at the bar a young waitress disrespectfully told us that we couldn't sit there as it's an adult area.  I asked why's that as we've always sat there before?  The waitress then actually opened her eyes and shut her mouth to see that my wife of 37 years was not a child.    I requested the bartender over to explain the rudeness of the young waitress and received no satisfaction of correcting the waitress on conduct. We then ordered two hamburgers, one medium and one well done.  Evidently even that was too much for them as they both came out rare.   We returned one hamburger to the kitchen and then the manager delivered the replacement hamburger.  She asked us to cut it at the table so she could INSPECT it?? After talking with the unresponsive manager, we left disappointed.   Red Robin's quality of service and food has declined so bad that we won't be returning.   What a disappointing lunch and experience!  After talking with 3 of the 4 people we dealt with I felt that they were all unaware how bad their quality of service and food has become.  Save your money and do yourself a favor and find a different restaurant!   Even if the food was free it cost too much!

The fish and chips was perfect last night. I would say it's the best in town. I go there only for the fish and chips sometimes it's absolutely magnificent, other times you burn your fingers touching the fish because of the Grease. So I would say it's up to the manager to make sure is that it is the way it should be every time it goes out

I went in to Red Robin with a friend for lunch the other day. We went to the bar to have lunch. The bartender was in a very cranky mood and I got attitude the whole time. I'm allergic to tomato, so I asked for my burger without. When it came out it had tomato on it and I had to send it back. So I waited while my friend ate his lunch. As soon as the replacement was brought out I was given the check. Being a former business owner and restaurant tour I don't like this practice and giving a customer the check when they barely started eating and after a major mistake. Still attitude from the bartender. I came home and filled out the survey and was contacted by corporate by email, saying that the store G and would be contacting me by the next day. So unprofessional, that they could not even do that. I have been going to this Red Robin since the very day they open their doors. No more, they have been going downhill, especially with service. When you tell a customer you were going to contact them then you better do it

Gave this place 4 stars. Just because one person gave you the worst service of your life, it doesn't mean the business should suffer.  Well I don't usually write reviews unless I've had a bad experience or a really awesome experience. Today was a bad experience. First and foremost, I'm pregnant & these cravings are insane!!  I was craving garlic fries from RR so we drove 40 minutes just so I can be happy lol (my poor husband!) Anyways, the host sat us down at our table & the waitress (Candice) comes by, introduces herself & that she'll be right back...maybe 7-9 minutes later she takes our order. Good job on the wait time  We start to order our food, I go first: Me: Can I have a Whiskey Bbq Burger with garlic fries please. Oh and also on a lettuce wrap (need to save room for them carbs).  Her: How do you want it cooked? Pink or no pink? Me: No pink & can I also have malt vinegar? & try the Buzzard sauce. (which btw was not a good sauce to try) Her: Vinegar?! **gives a disgusting look** Well alright. Me: haha, its my cravings. (But in actuality I love malt vinegar with my fries, it's like having salt & vinegar chips) *atm I'm feeling uncomfortable but able to joke around about what I ordered* My husband tells her what he wants & she says "at least you didn't order your meal with vinegar". I laughed because maybe she was just joking.  NOOOPE!!! I was wrong. Here's what went down...food arrives --it wasn't a very long wait, so yay for fast service -- and we started eating. Halfway through our food and the waitress comes by to check on how we are doing. & this woman, THIS FRICKEN WOMAN!!! had the audacity to act like she's gagging in front of my husband and I while we were eating & saying "ugh! That smell!" I actually looked at her and rolled my eyes because I found that very disrespectful. You guys don't know how pissed off I was & how I can really get when I'm being disrespected. After she left my husband said that was uncalled for. I totally agreed. The whole night at the table, no refills on water, mistaken order on fries I was really furious at her action. I didn't want to touch my fries because I felt uncomfortable about other people's thoughts on the malt vinegar smell. It didn't seem to bother anyone but her. Got our check & I wanted to pay for it because if my husband did he'd probably leave her tip she doesn't deserve. We usually tip 15%. NOT TODAY! She's lucky I even tipped (only $2) she doesn't deserve shit for the way she acted today. I wasn't gonna give her shit but people need to make a living somehow.  Anyways, got the receipt & spoke to the manager privately because I'm not the type to complain or make a big deal in front of people. He kept trying to give me a refund, but I told him it's alright, I'm here a lot. Just please talk to her about her actions. She can't be doing that in front of customers. I teared up because I was pissed.   Tip:  DON'T get Candice as a waitress if you like malt vinegar with your food.

Woah woah woah. Why so many low ratings guys? Red Robin is one of the best chains Tucson has! This location could use some work... I have to agree with other people's reviews about the poor service, but, imo other things make up for it. Everyone needs to know about their bottomless fries. You can order them with your drink and get them brought out with your drink so you can snack on them before your food comes. This is so amazing! My friend Ava usually eats two baskets and finishes mine before her food comes out. Bottomless fries= best thing ever

Today i took my children to this red robin and while the service was fine, it came to a halt when i noticed a bug in my son's freckled lemonade. I showed it to the waitress and told her it was a bug to which she decided to challenge me and tell me it was from the strawberries in his drink as she walked back to the bar. Although I hadfully analyzed that this was indeed a bug and know the difference between that and strawberry pulp/seeds I didnt reply. When she came back she said "oh we made him another one to go and he (the bartender) said it was probably a fruit fly that was around the bar". No apologies or anything like this was normal ops for this establishment. I wont be coming back here if its expected that these things happen no big deal. I was not looking for them to take the drink off and still paid for it but a sorry from the wait staff is not unreasonable.

Not coming back here.  The service on our last visit was that bad.  First, we are led to a table by an Igor-like person who will not stop asking questions about what I'm doing for my weekend.  We're in the loud, back room where kids are jumping on the seats and parents are drinking, trying to ignore them. Our waitress comes by to take our order, and at no point mentions that the kitchen is over an hour behind on orders.  We expect to be in and out at a hamburger joint.  We have to repeat our order about three times each, because she cannot hear us.  During the next 1 hour and 15 minutes, she only comes by twice to ask if we want refills.  On the second visit, we ask how we have not yet gotten our food.  We did not get an appetizer because we were in a hurry.  At that point she checks with the kitchen and says they are about to START cooking our food.  10 minutes later she says they had to remake ours because they forgot to add the tomato aioli, which we never wanted; she wrote it down wrong.  She goes to the kitchen to inform them of this, so they have to remake a third time.  It was over 1.5 hours by time we got our food.  When it was time to pay she asked why WE were giving her attitude.  We told her this is the worst service we've ever gotten at a Red Robin.  Instead of apologizing, getting her manager, or crediting our bill, she argued back that HER service was fine and that she has no control over how busy they are.  It's not that they are busy, but rather that this entire establishment is poorly run, hires rude employees, and makes no effort to provide quality customer service.  I will not be returning and recommend you do the same.

This restaurant has amazing food. I am really repulsed by the fact that they obviously force their servers (and I would imagine other employees as well) to cover their tattoos. Seriously...this isn't chik-fil-a. Are they closed on Sundays? What year is this again? Let your servers rock their tattoos because by making them wear bandages you are not only stifling their self-expression, but you are alienating your tattooed customers. Band-aids and bandages are for oozing pus and blood. Ridiculous that you should force your employees to disguise their self-expression behind something hat reminds your customers of bodily fluids. Quit being so archaic, Red Robin. Your customers don't appreciate it.

Red Robin is an amazing place to eat with the awesome pictures on the wall to the amazing onion rings this place is a delight I use to go to Red robin sometimes years ago but when I went again I had the best meal ever the onion rings are great the fries are great but I do have one complaint the salsa there for the chips isn't that good but besides that it's an awesome restaurant and I totally recommend it

I eat here semi-regularly, but don't usually review. Today I am because of the friendly, attentive service I received.  The food was fine - mushroom burger and fries, with a coke. The burger was hot and delicious, while the fries were a little overdone.  Baili was genuinely friendly without being overbearing, brought my food to the table quickly and filled my order accurately,  and checked on me a few times throughout the meal. Always courteous, and paid attention to when I needed a refill, or additional napkins. She also made sure to offer me more fries, asked if I'd like dessert.  I know Red Robin doesn't always offer the best service, but Baili is a gem. I hope she sticks around!
Deceiving rewards program. On 4 occasions their rewards system is down... how convenient especially when the rewards expire.

Really good burgers, and both my kids were happy with extra fries.  Get the app and rewards program to get a free burger any day in your birthday month!  Just make sure you keep track and let them know before you get the bill.

Love this place. It is not too loud  Great food cooked as requested  Shout out to Tracy our server.  She was friendly and knowledgeable. Kept checking on us without being a pest We will ask for her when we return

I had the banzai burger and unlimited fries.and it was very tasty!  The service was great and it is the place to go if you are in the Tucson Mall.  I like the idea of being able to get a beer or drink and then walk it off in the air conditioned shopping mall before driving away!  I would have given 5 stars, except for the following:  I don't like the thick cut steak fries, rather than normal-sized.  It's like eating a mashed potato with ketchup.  And, the beers were all the big breweries-  no local brews!

We have previously visited this location for to go food, and our ticket time, while the restaurant looked empty, was almost 40 minutes.  We love Red Robin so overlooked that negative experience and tried again.  The restaurant looked empty but we were told, "I can seat you when I have a server available."  After watching empty tables being walked by for about 10 minutes we were sat.  Relatively quickly our server Doris took both food and drinks orders at the same time.  My wife ordered a special burger with no lettuce and no tomato (due to a food allergy).  When our food arrived approximately 20 mins later her burger had scraps of lettuce and tomato seeds, seemingly indicating it had been prepared incorrectly and then scraped off, in addition to being cold, even though my burger was requested less cooked, and was hot.  We identified the issue to Doris and she was extremely polite, apologetic, and promised to make it right.  She said a manager would run the new burger.  When a man ran the burger he stated, "I have a new burger with..." and never apologized or identified who he was, or offered anything else.  The burger had lettuce on top of the bun. We paid the bill, and it had included my wife's incorrect burger.  I asked to speak to both a manager and Doris on our way out.  I explained how long we have loved Red Robin, our first bad experience at that location, and why I felt this experience was sub-par.  The manager never identified himself as a manager and then told me he was working front and back of the house, said sorry he wasn't wearing his sleeves, and that he was too busy to remember to take the burger off the bill, even though he meant to.  I asked if I could write a review that would help ID issues to corporate, and he said no since every location is franchised.  He said he was short staffed so needing to work both front and back of the house.   With the amount of food choices available in Tucson, with sub-par experiences like these two it makes it difficult for me to ever return to this location.  I don't want free offers or enticements to return, I honestly just would love for the Red Robin experience to be made available at this location.  How can we make this right?
Tracy is an AMAZING server!! They offer GF buns & have a GF fryer. Food was outstanding. Wonderful food & service!!

The bottomless fries were stale and old even the new set they brought back for us after we complained no manager ever came to the table our waitress could not be found so we had to have other people help us all I can say is very disappointed in the place that is supposed to be corporate and Gourmet Burgers won't be going back

Was not disappointed!  Wait was less than 10 min and our server was great.  Fed 8 people and the food was perfect.  The wedge was fantastic as well as the cowboy.  Kids enjoyed with leftovers to spare.  Will stop again.

The burgers are delish at red Ro in a nd their fries are tasty.   The smell of the restaurant can be better with the carpeted area in the mall side but the food is good.   The alcoholic drinks are made well and not watered down as u would expect.   All good and go there often.

Me and my date waited about 20 to be seated. Not a big deal this location has recently announced its closing so we thought we'd go one last time. The waitress was very good and attentive considering there were people everywhere. She was great. The fries and mozzarella sticks were delicious as ever. I had to give 3 stars because although I didn't mind the wait we were told 10 mins and waited about 20, and my burger didn't have a lot of flavor to it. I ended up dipping it in ranch to get a different taste to it. The staff were great, and I love the Red Robin signature spice.
The only reason for bad review is that they CLOSED the Tucson Location.  Red Robbin had some great burgers for the price. R.I.P Red Robbin I hope you open a new location in Tucson.
Closed, so I won't be going to the mall any more. Is there any other Red Robin's in Tucson?
